00021 #ifndef _RFM12_CORE_H
00022 #define _RFM12_CORE_H
00023 
00024 /************************
00025 * VARIOUS RFM RELATED DEFINES FOR INTERNAL USE        
00026 *(defines which shall be visible to the user are located in rfm12.h)
00027 */
00028 
00029 //default preamble (altrernating 1s and 0s)
00030 #define PREAMBLE 0xAA
00031 
00032 //default synchronization pattern
00033 #define SYNC_MSB 0x2D
00034 #define SYNC_LSB 0xD4
00035 
00036 //these are the states for the receive/transmit state machine
00037 #define STATE_RX_IDLE 0
00038 #define STATE_RX_ACTIVE 1
00039 #define STATE_TX 2
00040 
00041 //packet header length in bytes
00042 #define PACKET_OVERHEAD 3
00043 
00044 
00045 /************************
00046 * LIBRARY DEFAULT SETTINGS 
00047  */
00048  
00049 //if notreturns is not defined, we won't use this feature
00050 #ifndef RFM12_NORETURNS
00051          #define RFM12_NORETURNS 0
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 //if transmit only is not defined, we won't use this feature
00055 #ifndef RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY
00056          #define RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY 0
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 //if transmit only is on, we need to turn of collision detection
00060 #if RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY
00061          //disable collision detection, as we won't be able to receive data
00062          #ifdef RFM12_NOCOLLISIONDETECTION
00063                   #undef RFM12_NOCOLLISIONDETECTION
00064          #endif
00065          #define RFM12_NOCOLLISIONDETECTION 1
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 //if nocollisiondetection is not defined, we won't use this feature
00069 #ifndef RFM12_NOCOLLISIONDETECTION
00070          #define RFM12_NOCOLLISIONDETECTION 0
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 //if livectrl is not defined, we won't use this feature
00074 #ifndef RFM12_LIVECTRL
00075          #define RFM12_LIVECTRL 0
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 //if low battery detector is not defined, we won't use this feature
00079 #ifndef RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR
00080          #define RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR 0
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 //if the low battery detector feature is used, we will set some extra pwrmgmt options
00084 #if RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR
00085          //define PWRMGMT_LOW_BATT  with low batt detector
00086          //it will be used later
00087          #define PWRMGMT_LOW_BATT (RFM12_PWRMGT_EB)
00088          
00089          //check if the default power management setting has the LB bit set
00090          //and warn the user if it's not
00091          #ifdef PWRMGT_DEFAULT
00092                   #if !((PWRMGT_DEFAULT) & RFM12_PWRMGT_EB)
00093                            #warning "You are using the RFM12 low battery detector, but PWRMGT_DEFAULT has the low battery detector bit unset."
00094                   #endif
00095          #endif
00096 #else
00097          #define PWRMGMT_LOW_BATT 0
00098 #endif /* RFM12_LOW_BATT_DETECTOR */
00099 
00100 //if wakeuptimer is not defined, we won't use this feature
00101 #ifndef RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER
00102          #define RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER 0
00103 #endif
00104 
00105 //if wakeuptimer is on, we will set the default power management to use the wakeup timer
00106 #if RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER
00107          //define PWRMGMT_LOW_BATT  with low batt detector
00108          //it will be used later
00109          #define PWRMGMT_WKUP (RFM12_PWRMGT_EW)
00110          
00111          //check if the default power management setting has the EW bit set
00112          //and warn the user if it's not
00113          #ifdef PWRMGT_DEFAULT
00114                   #if !((PWRMGT_DEFAULT) & RFM12_PWRMGT_EW)
00115                            #warning "You are using the RFM12 wakeup timer, but PWRMGT_DEFAULT has the wakeup timer bit unset."
00116                   #endif
00117          #endif
00118 #else
00119          #define PWRMGMT_WKUP 0
00120 #endif /* RFM12_USE_WAKEUP_TIMER */
00121 
00122 //if ASK tx is not defined, we won't use this feature
00123 #ifndef RFM12_TRANSMIT_ASK
00124          #define RFM12_TRANSMIT_ASK 0
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 //if receive ASK is not defined, we won't use this feature
00128 #ifndef RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK
00129          #define RFM12_RECEIVE_ASK 0
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 //if software spi is not defined, we won't use this feature
00133 #ifndef RFM12_SPI_SOFTWARE
00134          #define RFM12_SPI_SOFTWARE 0
00135 #endif
00136 
00137 //if uart debug is not defined, we won't use this feature
00138 #ifndef RFM12_UART_DEBUG
00139          #define RFM12_UART_DEBUG 0
00140 #endif
00141  
00142 //default value for powermanagement register
00143 #ifndef PWRMGT_DEFAULT
00144          #define PWRMGT_DEFAULT (RFM12_PWRMGT_DC | PWRMGMT_WKUP | PWRMGMT_LOW_BATT)
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 //define a default receive power management mode
00148 #if RFM12_TRANSMIT_ONLY
00149          //the receiver is turned off by default in transmit only mode
00150          #define PWRMGT_RECEIVE (RFM12_CMD_PWRMGT | PWRMGT_DEFAULT)
00151 #else
00152          //the receiver is turned on by default in normal mode
00153          #define PWRMGT_RECEIVE (RFM12_CMD_PWRMGT | PWRMGT_DEFAULT | RFM12_PWRMGT_ER)
00154 #endif
00155 
00156 //default channel free time, if not defined elsewhere
00157 #ifndef CHANNEL_FREE_TIME
00158          #define CHANNEL_FREE_TIME 200
00159 #endif
00160 
00161 /*
00162  * backward compatibility for the spi stuff
00163  * these values weren't set in older revisions of this library
00164  * so they're now assumed to be on the same pin/port.
00165  * otherwise these defines serve to configure the software SPI ports
00166  */
00167 #ifndef DDR_MOSI
00168          #define DDR_MOSI DDR_SPI
00169          #define PORT_MOSI PORT_SPI
00170 #endif
00171 
00172 #ifndef DDR_MISO
00173          #define DDR_MISO DDR_SPI
00174          #define PIN_MISO PIN_SPI
00175 #endif
00176 
00177 #ifndef DDR_SCK
00178          #define DDR_SCK DDR_SPI
00179          #define PORT_SCK PORT_SPI
00180 #endif
00181 
00182 #ifndef DDR_SPI_SS
00183          #define DDR_SPI_SS DDR_SPI
00184          #define PORT_SPI_SS PORT_SPI
00185 #endif
00186 
00187 
00188 //baseband selection
00189 #if (RFM12_BASEBAND) == RFM12_BAND_433
00190          #define RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC(x) RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC_433(x)
00191 #elif (RFM12_BASEBAND) == RFM12_BAND_868
00192          #define RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC(x) RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC_868(x)
00193 #elif (RFM12_BASEBAND) == RFM12_BAND_915
00194          #define RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC(x) RFM12_FREQUENCY_CALC_915(x)
00195 #else
00196          #error "Unsupported RFM12 baseband selected."
00197 #endif
00198 
00199 
00200 /************************
00201 * HELPER MACROS
00202 */
00203 
00204 //macros to turn the int on and off
00205 //if polling is used, just define these macros as empty
00206 #if !(RFM12_USE_POLLING)
00207          #define RFM12_INT_ON() RFM12_INT_MSK |= (1<<RFM12_INT_BIT)
00208          #define RFM12_INT_OFF() RFM12_INT_MSK &= ~(1<<RFM12_INT_BIT)
00209 #else
00210          #define RFM12_INT_ON()
00211          #define RFM12_INT_OFF()
00212 #endif /* !(RFM12_USE_POLLING) */
00213 
00214 /*
00215  * the following macros help to manage the rfm12 fifo
00216  * default fiforeset is as follows:
00217  * 2 Byte Sync Pattern, disable sensitive reset, fifo filled interrupt at 8 bits
00218  */
00219 //default fiforeset register value to accept data
00220 #define ACCEPT_DATA (RFM12_CMD_FIFORESET | RFM12_FIFORESET_DR | (8<<4) | RFM12_FIFORESET_FF)
00221 #define ACCEPT_DATA_INLINE (RFM12_FIFORESET_DR | (8<<4) | RFM12_FIFORESET_FF)
00222 //default fiforeset register value to clear fifo
00223 #define CLEAR_FIFO (RFM12_CMD_FIFORESET | RFM12_FIFORESET_DR | (8<<4))
00224 #define CLEAR_FIFO_INLINE (RFM12_FIFORESET_DR | (8<<4))
00225 
00226 //this macro helps to encapsulate the return values, when noreturn is set to on
00227 #if (RFM12_NORETURNS)
00228          #define TXRETURN(a)
00229 #else
00230          #define TXRETURN(a) (a)
00231 #endif
00232 
00233 #endif /* _RFM12_CORE_H */
